title: @Riot Question for your Lore Team
body:
I've read my fair share of the League of Legends Lore, but I was curious if anywhere it explains the reasoning behind heat seeking auto attacks and skills?

Is it actively acknowledged by the Champions or anyone? The fact that someone like Vayne can fire an arrow at you that will follow you, even through walls until it hits you or that you can teleport/blink/flash and still be hit. You would think it would perhaps raise suspicion.

I think a lot of things are answered and explained in the lore, but I'm curious about the unanswered questions more. I may just be digging too deeply into a game mechanic, but I'm curious about the explanation story-wise, if there even is one.

replies.body:
No, purely gameplay.

Several mage attacks might make sense, but stuff like arrows or bullets are not supposed to be heat seeking, yet they are due to the game being as it is.

Kyoki FTW. The game world and story world aren't exact matches. There are things needed due to gameplay that are not explained by story. Instead of things being "heat seeking," our Champions in the story world are usually just really good marksmen, blade throwers, archers etc.

I'm curious, is there any champion one would _assume_ uses magic based on his/her gameplay, whom in the lore doesn't? I've been thinking about this in relation to {{champion:91}}, for example. He has levitating blades and a Shumpo-style move, but this wasn't mentioned at all in his old lore-material, so it seems at least ambiguous from the lore-side? 

Other examples that I feel are _somewhat_ ambiguous are {{champion:84}}, {{champion:107}}, {{champion:36}}, {{champion:86}}, {{champion:64}}, {{champion:11}},{{champion:2}}, {{champion:80}}, {{champion:78}} & {{champion:98}}. To what extent do their in-game abilities correspond with their abilities in the story-world? 
How important, extraordinary and explainable is **Katarina's** ability to shumpo; is it "noteworthy" that she can do that, considering it hasn't been "commented on", other than art and videos _showing_ that she _can_ do it? Does Lee Sin use magical or regular sound? Is there an explanaiton for Rengar's stealth-ability other than "he just can"? Does Mundo _actually_ summon orbiting fire? Is it commonplace or explainable for Shen/Garen/Poppy to do something like their ults? Is this something that you intend to explore in future stories?

A more generalized and non-specific answer would also be welcome, of course.
I'm quite sure kat has a small amount of magical ability that she uses to shunpo, but the rest is just a lot of skill with blades.

I always assumed enchanted weaponry. Riven's sword is a good example of that.

Other than that, just because you aren't necessarily a mage, doesn't mean you cant learn a few combat spells just to give you an edge. Even though it isn't specific on how they did.
So, I'm assuming when I kill somebody with a boomerang thats in the fog of war as they flash over a wall, Gnars just a really good thrower? Haha, I knew the kid had it in him!
